usefulItems: cling film, rolling pin, muslin or nut milk bag, baking paper, refrigerator, grill
title: Lemon Chicken with Couscous and Tzatziki

ingredients.content: ½ lemon, finely grated zest only
3 chicken breasts, skinless, butterflied (sliced through horizontally almost to the edge then opened out)
1 pinch fine sea salt, plus extra to taste
1 pinch ground black pepper, plus extra to taste

preparations.content: Place olive oil, oregano and lemon zest in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Place butterflied chicken breasts between two large pieces of cling film and flatten with a rolling pin. Place chicken in a dish and pour over marinade. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in yoghurt. Remove bowl and set aside.

Place courgette in mixing bowl and chop <b>Turbo/0.5 sec/1-2 times<b>. Tip out into a muslin cloth and squeeze out liquid. Stir squeezed courgette into yoghurt and adjust seasoning to taste. Set tzatziki aside in fridge.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl. Preheat grill to 230°C.

Line Varoma dish with enough baking paper to come 2-3 cm up the sides, then place into position. Weigh in couscous, peas, olives, red peppers and spring onions. Sprinkle 75 g water over couscous and vegetables then stir with a fork to moisten. Cover Varoma  then steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Sprinkle another 50 g water over couscous and vegetables and stir well with a fork. Cover Varoma and steam again <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, grill marinated chicken for 5 minutes (230°C) on each side until browned.
Slice grilled chicken into strips and serve with couscous and tzatziki on the side.

hintsAndTricks: The method in the recipe produces a lighter, steamed couscous. If you prefer, you can soak the couscous in 250 g water for 5 minutes then steam as directed in the recipe.
To butterfly a chicken breast, use a sharp knife to slice into one side of the breast, starting at the thicker end and ending at the thin point. Open out the breast so that it resembles a butterfly.
